conclusion: Determine the voltage of the power source.
When the switch is open, only the resistor R1 is connected to the voltage source.
The current through R1 is measured by the ammeter, I0 = 0.5A.
The resistance of R1 is 20Ω.
By Ohm's law, the voltage across R1 is U = I0 R1 = 0.5A × 20Ω = 10V.
Since R1 is directly connected to the voltage source, the voltage of the power source is U = 10V.
Analyze the circuit when the switch is closed.
When the switch is closed, the resistor R1 and the motor M are connected in parallel to the voltage source.
The voltage across R1 is U = 10V, and the voltage across the motor is also U = 10V.
The current through R1 is I1 = U/R1 = 10V/20Ω = 0.5A.
The power consumed by R1 is P1 = U I1 = 10V × 0.5A = 5W.
Analyze the power consumed by the motor.
The motor has an internal resistance R2 = 10Ω.
When the motor is rotating, it also produces a back EMF E_{back}.
The current through the motor is I_M = (U - E_{back})/R2.
Since the motor is rotating, E_{back} > 0.
The power consumed by the motor is P_M = U I_M.
Determine the range of the current through the motor when rotating.
